alert.note: Alert for Rawlins; Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 11:29PM CST until December 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM MST /3 AM CST/ TO 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations ranging anywhere from 1 to 4 inches. Northwesterly winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Sherman County and Rawlins County in Kansas and Hitchcock County in Nebraska. * WHEN...From 2 AM MST /3 AM CST/ to 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions associated with snow, blowing snow, and strong northwesterly winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may be preceded by a brief period of freezing drizzle. In other words, hazardous travel conditions may exist before it begins to snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, slow down, turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution, particularly at intersections and highway on-ramps and off-ramps where accidents are more likely to occur. Decelerating abruptly or making sharp turns at a high rate of speed may result in loss of vehicle control. Avoid sudden accelerations and decelerations. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
